events.title: Security Council LIVE: Attacks against Ukrainian civilians unacceptable, unjustifiable and must stop, says UN
events.description: The UN Security Council is meeting in emergency session in New York over Russia‚Äôs ongoing deadly missile and drone strikes targeting Ukrainian civilians and energy infrastructure, as frigid winter conditions grip the war-torn country. Millions have been deprived of electricity, heating and water. The UN Secretary-General has called the stepped up attacks an unacceptable violation of international humanitarian law. Follow live below and find all our in-depth meetings coverage here. UN News app users can go here.

events.title: Quarter of developing countries poorer than in 2019, World Bank finds
events.description: Global growth ‚Äòdownshifted‚Äô since Covid pandemic and sub-Saharan Africa particularly affected, report says Business live ‚Äì latest updates A quarter of countries in the developing world are poorer than they were in 2019 before the Covid pandemic, the World Bank has found. The Washington-based organisation said a large group of low-income countries, many in sub-Saharan Africa, had suffered a negative shock in the six years to the end of last year. Continue reading...

events.title: Trump‚Äôs other Latin American feud: why Colombia‚Äôs Petro is not Maduro
events.description: Leftwing leader rallies his supporters as US president accuses him of drug trafficking and threatens military action A leftwing South American firebrand calls for his followers to rally in public squares nationwide to defend his country‚Äôs sovereignty and decry verbal attacks from Donald Trump. The US president accuses the leader of personally flooding American streets with illegal drugs and imposes sanctions against him and his wife. Threats of military action are followed by a phone conversation between the two leaders. One might imagine that this is a description of the buildup of tensions that led to the 3 January special forces raid on Caracas to capture the Venezuelan leader, Nicol√°s Maduro, and his wife, Cilia Flores, to face several criminal charges in New York. Continue reading...

events.title: Iran: UN human rights chief ‚Äòdeeply disturbed‚Äô by protest-related violence
events.description: The UN human rights chief has called for an independent and transparent investigation into reports of deaths and widespread arrests during ongoing nationwide protests in Iran, amid mounting concerns over the use of force by security forces.

events.title: World News in Brief: Ending famine, refugee solidarity in Kenya, Ukraine civilian casualties update
events.description: The head of the UN‚Äôs emergency food agency has urged world leaders on Monday to end ‚Äúman-made famines‚Äù and conflicts that ‚Äúdrive hunger and desperation‚Äù.

events.title: Armed Iranian protesters battle police in Tehran streets as Trump warns of forceful US response
events.description: Protests in Iran turn more violent with 65 reportedly killed by Friday and over 2,300 arrested as authorities imposed an internet blackout amid nationwide anti-regime unrest.

events.title: Two weeks on, questions linger over targeting and impact of US airstrikes in Nigeria
events.description: Very little information has been shared about strikes in Sokoto state Two weeks after the US carried out Christmas Day airstrikes in north-west Nigeria on what it described as Islamic State fighters, questions remain over the specific group that was targeted and the operation‚Äôs impact. In the aftermath of the strikes, Donald Trump said in a post on his Truth Social platform that ‚ÄúISIS Terrorist Scum in Northwest Nigeria , who have been targeting and viciously killing, primarily, innocent Christians‚Äù were hit with ‚Äúnumerous perfect strikes‚Äù. Continue reading...

events.title: US gives terrorist designation to Muslim Brotherhood in Egypt, Lebanon, Jordan
events.description: The US on Tuesday designated the Egyptian, Lebanese and Jordanian chapters of the Muslim Brotherhood as terrorist organisations, accusing them of "violence and destabilisation".

events.title: UK launches investigation into Musk's Grok amidst global backlash
events.description: Grok - the AI chatbot developed my Elon Musk's company - is facing growing international backlash for being misused to generate sexually explicit and nonconsensual images. Malaysia and Indonesia have become the first countries to block Grok over the weekend, while a UK media regulator launched a formal investigation into the platform X on January 11. The scandal is fuelling debate on generative AI tools that can produce realistic images, and the lack of safeguards failing to prevent its abuse.

events.title: Iran flips ‚Äòkill switch‚Äô to hide alleged crimes as death toll rises amid protests
events.description: Iran protests spread to 180 cities as authorities allegedly use lethal force against demonstrators, with human rights activists in Iran reporting 65 killed and 2,300 arrested.

events.title: US plan to exploit Venezuela‚Äôs oil could eat up 13% of carbon budget to keep 1.5C limit
events.description: Exclusive: ClimatePartner analysis shows how move would risk plunging Earth further into climate catastrophe US plans to exploit Venezuela‚Äôs oil reserves could by 2050 consume more than a tenth of the world‚Äôs remaining carbon budget to limit global heating to 1.5C, according to an exclusive analysis. The calculation highlights how any moves to further exploit the South American nation‚Äôs oil reserves ‚Äì the largest in the world, at least on paper ‚Äì would put increasing pressure on climate goals, and risk plunging the Earth further into climate catastrophe. Continue reading...

events.title: Iran's Khamenei issues direct warning to United States in Russian-language posts
events.description: Iran's Supreme Leader Ali Khamenei issues warning to U.S. in Russian on social media, signaling Tehran's growing alignment with Moscow amid nationwide protests.

events.title: People in Iran describe heavy security and some damage in first calls to outside world
events.description: Iranians made phone calls abroad for the first time in days Tuesday after authorities severed communications during a crackdown on nationwide protests that activists say killed at least 646 people.

events.title: At least 2,000 protesters killed in Iran, with footage suggesting summary executions
events.description: The death toll from nationwide protests in Iran spiked January 12 to at least 2,000 people killed, activists say. With the Internet down in Iran, gauging the demonstrations from abroad has grown more difficult. The Associated Press has been unable to independently assess the toll. Iran‚Äôs government hasn‚Äôt offered overall casualty figures. FRANCE 24's Ershad Alijani, journalist at the Observers' desk, tells us more about their findings.

events.title: Carney heads to Beijing as Trump‚Äôs America First agenda forces Canada into trade rethink
events.description: Canada‚Äôs PM seeks to smooth over past ructions in relationship with China as trade war takes its toll During the final stretch of Canada‚Äôs spring election campaign, Mark Carney told a debate audience that China was the country‚Äôs ‚Äúbiggest geopolitical risk‚Äù. He pointed to its attempts to meddle in elections and its recent efforts to disrupt Canada‚Äôs Arctic claims. When Carney‚Äôs government plane touches down in Beijing this week, it will be the first time a Canadian prime minister has been welcomed in nearly a decade. The trip, undertaken amid the rupturing of global economic and political alliances , reflects a desire by Ottawa to mend a broken relationship with a global superpower that uses its vast and lucrative market to both woo and punish countries. Continue reading...

events.title: Deaths overtake births in France for first time since World War II
events.description: More people died than were born in France last year for the first time since the end of World War II, official figures released on Tuesday indicated. France has long maintained comparatively high birthrates in the face of a widespread drop in the number of children being born across Europe and beyond.

events.title: Gaza: A ceasefire that still kills children is not enough, says UNICEF
events.description: Airstrikes, drone attacks and hypothermia continue in Gaza despite the ceasefire, with more than 100 youngsters killed since early October, the UN Children‚Äôs Fund (UNICEF) said on Tuesday.

events.title: Gaza: Storms worsen already dire humanitarian situation, UN warns
events.description: The humanitarian crisis across the Gaza Strip remains extremely serious, with harsh winter weather threatening to reverse recent gains in aid delivery, the United Nations said on Monday.

events.title: UN chief ‚Äòshocked‚Äô by reports of excessive force against protesters in Iran
events.description: The UN Secretary-General is shocked by reports of violence and excessive use of force by Iranian authorities against protesters across the country, urging restraint and the immediate restoration of communications as unrest enters its third week.

events.title: Sudan war leaves millions hungry and displaced as health system nears collapse
events.description: Sudan‚Äôs protracted conflict has spiralled into one of the world‚Äôs most severe humanitarian crises, with hunger, displacement and the collapse of basic services exacting a daily toll on civilians.

events.title: NSW government calls for rethink on capital gains tax discount to ease housing affordability
events.description: Federal parliamentary inquiry hears tax concessions undercut policies, including first home buyer assistance Follow our Australia news live blog for latest updates Generous capital gains tax rules have pushed up property prices and damaged housing affordability, the NSW government says, warning the discount benefits wealthy investors at the expense of first-time buyers. NSW Treasury has told a federal parliamentary inquiry into the 50% CGT discount that tax concessions including negative gearing ‚Äúskew incentives towards property investment‚Äù and undercut policies, including first home buyer assistance. Continue reading...

events.title: UN World Court begins landmark hearings on Rohingya genocide case against Myanmar
events.description: Public hearings opened on Monday at the International Court of Justice (ICJ) in a landmark case brought by the Gambia against Myanmar, alleging violations of the Genocide Convention over the military‚Äôs treatment of the Rohingya minority.

events.title: World News in Brief: Repression in Uganda, fighting in Syria‚Äôs Aleppo continues, Gaza and West Bank updates
events.description: The UN has raised serious concerns ahead of Uganda‚Äôs elections scheduled for 15 January, warning they will take place in an environment marked by widespread repression, intimidation and shrinking civic space.

events.title: South Sudan: Increase in abductions and sexual violence ‚Äòunacceptable‚Äô
events.description: Despite reductions in the overall number of conflict-related incidents in South Sudan, a rise in abductions and sexual violence is concerning, the UN peacekeeping mission in the country, UNMISS, said on Friday.

events.title: Tyler Robinson prosecutors say Charlie Kirk shooting texts show confusion, not bias, to rebut conflict claim
events.description: Accused Charlie Kirk assassin Tyler Robinson seeks to disqualify prosecutor whose child witnessed the fatal shooting at Utah Valley University campus.

events.title: DOJ charges illegal immigrant with Tren de Aragua ties after Border Patrol shooting in Portland
events.description: An alleged Tren de Aragua gang member faces federal charges for ramming Border Patrol vehicle in Portland shooting incident that sparked nationwide protests.

events.title: US labels Muslim Brotherhood in Egypt, Lebanon, Jordan as ‚Äòterrorists‚Äô
events.description: Top US diplomat Marco Rubio says Washington will 'use all available tools' to counter Muslim Brotherhood branches.

events.title: Attempt to overturn the Gambia‚Äôs ban on FGM heard by supreme court
events.description: Case brought by Muslim leaders and MP follows failed 2024 bid and seen as part of global anti-women‚Äôs rights backlash A group of religious leaders and an MP in the Gambia have launched efforts to overturn a ban on female genital mutilation at the country‚Äôs supreme court. The court case, due to resume this month, comes after two babies bled to death after undergoing FGM in the Gambia last year. Almameh Gibba, an MP and one of the plaintiffs, tabled a bill to decriminalise FGM that was rejected by the country‚Äôs parliament in 2024. Continue reading...

events.title: Iranian on trial in France in case that could help release of French hostages
events.description: With the situation tense over in Iran, one of the country's national's is facing justice here in France. Mahdieh Esfandiari, a professional translator, is on trial in Paris, facing accusations of promoting terrorism. Her case is being closely watched in Tehran, where two French nationals have been detained since 2022. With Esfan-diari's trial now underway, the pair's release could be on the horizon, depending on the outcome.

events.title: What to know about the Muslim Brotherhood after the US terrorist designation
events.description: The Trump administration has designated the Lebanese, Jordanian and Egyptian chapters of the Muslim Brotherhood as terrorist organizations

events.title: Trump admin labels Muslim Brotherhood branches as terrorist organizations
events.description: The U.S. designates the Lebanese, Jordanian and Egyptian chapters of the Muslim Brotherhood as terrorist organizations, saying they pose risks to the U.S.

events.title: Trump tells Iranian protesters 'help is on its way' and cancels talks with officials
events.description: US President Donald Trump said on January 13 he‚Äôs cancelled talks with Iranian officials amid a protest crackdown, telling Iranian citizens ‚Äúhelp is on its way.‚Äù Trump did not offer any details about what the help would entail, but it comes after the Republican president earlier said Iran wants to negotiate with Washington after his threat to strike the Islamic Republic that has killed more than 2,000, according to human right monitors. FRANCE 24's Kethevane Gorjestani tells us more.

events.title: Ukraine war: UN appeals for $2.3 billion to support aid teams‚Äô ‚Äòheroic work‚Äô
events.description: Amid ongoing and intensifying Russian attacks across Ukraine, the UN on Tuesday launched a $2.3 billion humanitarian appeal for 2026 to support 4.1 million of the country‚Äôs most vulnerable people.

events.title: Ukraine: Deadly Russian strikes push civilians deeper into winter crisis
events.description: Ukraine has entered the new year under intensifying and deadly Russian attacks which have crippled energy systems and left millions without heating, electricity or water amid freezing temperatures, senior UN officials told the Security Council on Monday.

events.title: Germany: Gelsenkirchen bank thieves used 'manipulated' door
events.description: Police say a manipulated emergency exit, that shouldn't open from the outside, gave thieves access in last month's major bank heist in Gelsenkirchen. They warned customers that investigations would likely take months.

events.title: Iran‚Äôs ‚Äòdistinctive‚Äô drone deployment sees death toll soar amid violent protests
events.description: Iran allegedly deploys drones amid nationwide protests as Human Rights Activists News Agency reports at least 544 confirmed deaths and over 10,000 arrests.

events.title: Netanyahu and Rubio discuss US military intervention in Iran amid ongoing nationwide protests: report
events.description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu and U.S. Secretary of State Marco Rubio spoke as Israel goes on high alert and Iran faces mounting anti-regime protests.

events.title: China pressing European countries to bar Taiwan politicians or face crossing a ‚Äòred line‚Äô
events.description: Exclusive: Chinese officials are using a ‚Äòhighly specific‚Äô interpretation of EU rules to suggest Taiwanese figures should not be granted visas, officials say Chinese officials have been pushing ‚Äúlegal advice‚Äù on European countries, saying their own border laws require them to ban entry to Taiwanese politicians, according to more than half a dozen diplomats and officials familiar with the matter. The officials made demarches to European embassies in Beijing, or through local embassies directly to European governments in their capital cities, warning the European countries not to ‚Äútrample on China‚Äôs red lines‚Äù, according to the European diplomats and ministries who spoke to the Guardian. Continue reading...

events.title: Coal power generation falls in China and India for first time since 1970s
events.description: ‚ÄòHistoric‚Äô moment in biggest coal-consuming countries could bring decline in global emissions, analysis says Coal power generation fell in China and India for the first time since the 1970s last year, in a ‚Äúhistoric‚Äù moment that could bring a decline in global emissions, according to analysis. The simultaneous fall in coal-powered electricity in the world‚Äôs biggest coal-consuming countries had not happened since 1973, according to analysts at the Centre for Research on Energy and Clean Air, and was driven by a record roll-out of clean energy projects. Continue reading...

events.title: Paris's annual agriculture show will be cow-free for first time ever due to lumpy skin disease
events.description: Cows will be conspicuously absent from this year's International Agriculture Show in Paris following an outbreak of lumpy skin disease, organisers said Tuesday. Europe's largest agricultural fair usually boasts between 500 to 600 cattle.

events.title: Four people killed in Gaza after walls collapse on tents during strong winds - health officials
events.description: Four people have been killed in Gaza after walls collapsed on to tents during strong winds and rainfall, hospital authorities have said.

events.title: Trump risks China trade war truce through Iran tariffs
events.description: On the face of it, an announcement of 25% tariffs against any nation trading with Iran amounts to a major escalation of Donald Trump's global trade war.

events.title: Iranians able to make some international calls as internet remains blocked amid protests
events.description: Iranians could make phone calls abroad after a communications blackout during a crackdown on anti-regime protests, but internet and text messaging remain restricted.

events.title: Family dog rescued after chewing battery-powered heated glove, sparking house fire
events.description: A dog was rescued from a house fire after accidentally starting the blaze by chewing a battery-powered glove, Ottawa authorities said. No injuries were reported.

events.title: 'They just kept killing': Eyewitnesses describe deadly crackdown in Iran
events.description: The BBC has received eyewitness accounts of security forces attacking anti-government protesters across the country.

events.title: Iran at geopolitical crossroads as protests pressure regime
events.description: The Islamic Republic is a key player in the Middle East, with close ties to Russia and China. As the regime in Tehran comes under fire, DW looks at Iran's place on the global stage.

events.title: üî¥ Live: Death toll from nationwide protests in Iran spikes to at least 2,000, activists say
events.description: No description available.

events.title: Fact-finding mission urges Iran to end protest violence and restore internet
events.description: The UN-mandated independent human rights fact-finding mission on Iran has urged authorities to immediately restore internet access and halt the violent crackdown of the ongoing, nationwide protest.

events.title: As Trump urges deal, Cuban president warns that the country will defend itself 'to the last drop of blood'
events.description: As Trump pressured Cuba to strike a deal, Cuban President Miguel D√≠az-Canel Berm√∫dez asserted that the country will defend itself "to the last drop of blood."

events.title: Trump administration ends temporary protected status for Somalis in US
events.description: Noem claims conditions have improved in east African country so Somalis no longer qualify for legal protections The Trump administration is terminating temporary protected status (TPS) for Somalis living in the United States, giving hundreds of people two months to leave the country or face deportation. The homeland security secretary, Kristi Noem , said in a statement that conditions in the east African country had improved sufficiently and that Somalis no longer qualified for the designation under federal law. Continue reading...

events.title: Trump continues to threaten military action against Iran
events.description: Amid a deadly crackdown on protesters in Iran, President Trump continues to threaten military action against Tehran and warned countries that do business with Iran that he could impose a tariff.

events.title: As Australia burns, locals learn to adapt
events.description: Another Australian summer, another spate of catastrophic wildfires. As DW's Stuart Braun watched the flames rip through Victoria in recent days, he says the response has been very different to those in the past.

events.title: Iran says 'ready for war' as Trump weighs strikes
events.description: US ‚Å†President Donald Trump urged Iranians on Tuesday to keep protesting and said help was on the way, without giving details. The US-based Human Rights Activists News Agency said Tuesday that at least 2,000 people have died in the ongoing protests in Iran and brutal government crackdown.

events.title: Uganda's military deployed in national capital ahead of upcoming presidential election
events.description: Uganda President Yoweri Museveni and his opponents have held their final rallies ahead of the country's next election

events.title: Russia launches another major attack on Ukraine's power grid and other sites, 4 dead
events.description: Russia has launched another major drone and missile attack on Ukraine that targeted the country's power grid

events.title: At the heart of change: Spotlight Initiative highlights breakthroughs in tackling gender-based violence
events.description: When it comes to protecting women and girls from gender-based violence, change happens when they are ‚Äúat the heart of every decision,‚Äù according to Erin Kenny, Global Coordinator of the Spotlight Initiative a United Nations‚ÄìEuropean Union partnership aimed at tackling all forms of abuse against women and girls.

events.title: Florida sheriff Grady Judd fires off warning to gangsters after 'Sex, Money, Murder' kingpin taken down
events.description: Gang leader Hernando Thompson convicted on 17 felony counts including racketeering, faces up to five life sentences in Florida "Sex, Money, Murder" case.

events.title: Iranian ambassador summoned over country's response to protests
events.description: Yvette Cooper has confirmed the government has summoned the Iranian ambassador in a statement to the Commons.

events.title: 'He was shot in the heart... many of his friends are dead': Family's shock over teen's death in Iran
events.description: In a large warehouse on the outskirts of Tehran, the floor is covered in dozens - or possibly hundreds - of black plastic body bags.

events.title: Landslide in eastern Congo kills at least 13, leaves over 30 missing
events.description: A landslide in eastern Congo has killed at least 13 people and left over 30 missing

events.title: Ukraine: Massive overnight attack leaves millions in the dark
events.description: UN agencies are supporting efforts on Friday to keep energy services up and running in Ukraine, and families warm amid freezing winter temperatures, following a large-scale overnight attack.

events.title: They bought an abandoned 'ghost house' in the Japanese countryside
events.description: He'd spent years backpacking around the world, and Japanese traveler Daisuke Kajiyama was finally ready to return home to pursue his long-held dream of opening up a guesthouse.

events.title: South Korean prosecutors demand death penalty for former president Yoon Suk Yeol
events.description: Yoon is on trial for insurrection charges, after trying to declare martial law in late 2024 South Korean prosecutors have demanded the death penalty for former president Yoon Suk Yeol over his failed martial law declaration in December 2024, in the first insurrection trial of a Korean head of state in three decades. Prosecutors characterised the case as the ‚Äúserious destruction of constitutional order by anti-state forces‚Äù, telling Seoul central district court that Yoon had ‚Äúdirectly and fundamentally infringed upon the safety of the state and the survival and freedom of the people‚Äù. Continue reading...

events.title: Malaysia blocks Elon Musk‚Äôs Grok AI over fake, sexualised images
events.description: Country follows Indonesia in restricting access after global outcry over X‚Äôs AI tool Malaysia has become the second country to temporarily block access to Elon Musk‚Äôs Grok after a global outcry over the AI tool and its ability to produce fake, sexualised images. Malaysia said it would restrict access to Grok until effective safeguards were implemented, a day after similar action was taken by Indonesia. Continue reading...

events.title: UN International Court of Justice to hear 1st genocide case in over a decade
events.description: The United Nations International Court of Justice is hearing a genocide case for the first time in more than a decade. The case is focused on the persecution of Rohingya Muslims in Myanmar.

events.title: What the US withdrawal from UN bodies could mean for climate, trade and development
events.description: The United States‚Äô intention to withdraw from a host of UN bodies announced this week targets programmes and initiatives focusing on a wide range of crucial areas, including the climate crisis, trade, gender and development.

events.title: Iran set to hang protester in what would mark first execution tied to anti-regime demonstrations
events.description: Iran is reportedly set to execute its first protester linked to mass arrests over the widespread anti-regime demonstrations. More than 500 people were also killed in the crackdown.

events.title: World central bank chiefs 'stand in solidarity' with US Fed chair Powell
events.description: Eleven central banks have backed Jerome Powell after the US launched a criminal investigation into the US Fed.

events.title: Iran-US diplomacy won‚Äôt succeed if ‚Äúfocus on nuclear issue‚Äù
events.description: ‚ÄúI don‚Äôt think the prospects look particularly good for diplomacy to succeed.‚Äù

events.title: Workers at Chinese factory that produces Labubu toys are being exploited, says NGO
events.description: Exclusive: China Labor Watch says people aged 16-18 employed without required special protections A labour rights NGO says it has found evidence of worker exploitation in the supply chain of Labubus, the furry toys that took the world by storm last year and which are expected to continue to grow in popularity in 2026. Labubus, toothy gremlins made by the Chinese toy company Pop Mart, have become one of China‚Äôs hottest cultural exports. In the first half of 2025 alone, ‚Äúthe Monsters‚Äù line of toys, which includes Labubus, generated 4.8bn yuan (¬£511m) in sales for the Hong Kong-listed company. In August, Pop Mart‚Äôs chief executive, Wang Ning, said the company was on track to reach 20bn yuan in revenues in 2025. Continue reading...

events.title: Five severed heads found hanging on Ecuador beach amid escalating gang clashes
events.description: Ecuador gang violence escalates as five severed heads discovered on tourist beach in Puerto Lopez, highlighting country's record homicide rate amid military crackdown.

events.title: Key questions for FBI investigators to unpick in Minneapolis shooting
events.description: Officials will examine video footage and policy guidelines as part of the investigation, experts told the BBC.

events.title: Germany news: 2 men charged with planning attacks for Russia
events.description: Two Ukrainians have been accused of planning sabotage attacks for Russian spy services. Meanwhile, Germany's foreign minister has played down the US threat to Greenland. DW has more.

events.title: Kazakhstan oil output plunges as Ukrainian drones strike Russia
events.description: Kyiv's attacks on Russian oil terminals and refineries damage their enemy, but impact other economies such as Kazakhstan and risk alienating allies.

events.title: 'We choose Denmark' over the US, Greenland‚Äôs PM says
events.description: Greenlandic Prime Minister Jens-Frederik Nielsen said the Arctic territory was facing a "geopolitical crisis" as Trump threatens to take it over. Denmark's Mette Frederiksen condemned "unacceptable pressure" from the US.

events.title: Trump tells Iranian protesters 'help is on its way'
events.description: US President Donald Trump called upon demonstrators in Iran to "keep protesting" against state institutions. Trump has previously threatened to intervene in response to the crackdown meted out on protesters. DW has more.

events.title: Trump to lead largest ever US delegation to Davos
events.description: President Donald Trump will attend the World Economic Forum in Davos next week as head of the largest ever US delegation to attend the annual meeting, including five cabinet members, and a host of congressional representatives and state governors.

events.title: Russian ship captain in court accused of 'grossly negligent' behaviour over North Sea crash
events.description: A Russian ship captain has been accused in court of "grossly negligent conduct" after a fatal collision with an oil tanker near the Humber Estuary last year.

events.title: Anti-ICE agitators swarm vehicle of conservative influencer Nick Sortor
events.description: Nick Sortor says anti-ICE protesters swarmed his vehicle in Minnesota, smashing windows and blocking his route.

events.title: Cuba‚Äôs president defiant, says no negotiations scheduled as Trump moves to choke off oil lifeline
events.description: Cuba rejects Trump's deal demands as Venezuelan oil lifeline ends. President D√≠az-Canel says no negotiations with Washington despite energy crisis threats.

events.title: Bangladesh won‚Äôt play T20 World Cup matches in India, BCB reaffirms
events.description: Bangladesh reiterates its request to the ICC to relocate its fixtures, citing player safety and security concerns.

events.title: The Gaza graffiti artist using shattered buildings as a canvas
events.description: A Palestinian graffiti artist in Gaza is turning destroyed buildings and collapsed walls into canvases.

events.title: These were the best and worst places for air quality in 2021, new report shows
events.description: Air pollution spiked to unhealthy levels around the world in 2021, according to a new report.

events.title: Venezuela begins releasing political prisoners, but hundreds remain behind bars
events.description: Venezuela has freed a handful of detainees in what it calls a gesture of national unity. Rights groups say releases are slow and the country's repressive system remains in place.

events.title: Iranian stands trial in France over social media posts ahead of possible prisoner swap
events.description: The four-day trial of Iranian translator Mahdieh Esfandiari on accusations of promoting "terrorism" via her social media posts opened on Tuesday. The case has been linked to a possible prisoner swap to secure the release of French citizens Cecile Kohler and Jacques Paris, who were imprisoned in Iran on espionage charges their families have denied.

events.title: US opens new air defense operations cell at Qatar base that Iran targeted in retaliatory attack
events.description: U.S. opens new air defense cell at Al Udeid Air Base in Qatar amid Iran tensions, enhancing regional missile defense cooperation across Middle East.

events.title: Trump threatens to block ExxonMobil from Venezuela after CEO calls country ‚Äòuninvestable‚Äô
events.description: US president says company is ‚Äòplaying too cute‚Äô after CEO responds sceptically to his push for oil investment after deposing Nicol√°s Maduro Donald Trump has said he might block ExxonMobil from investing in Venezuela after the oil company‚Äôs chief executive called the country ‚Äúuninvestable‚Äù during a White House meeting last week. Darren Woods told the US president that Venezuela would need to change its laws before it could be an attractive investment opportunity, during the high-profile meeting on Friday with at least 17 other oil executives. Continue reading...

events.title: Australian author Craig Silvey charged with possessing and distributing child exploitation material
events.description: Jasper Jones and Runt writer charged after search warrant issued at his Fremantle home on Monday Follow our Australia news live blog for latest updates Get our breaking news email , free app or daily news podcast Prominent Australian author Craig Silvey has been charged with possessing and distributing child exploitation material. Silvey, 43, had a search warrant issued at his Fremantle home on Monday, 12 January, where detectives allegedly found him ‚Äúactively engaging with other child exploitation offenders online‚Äù. Continue reading...

events.title: Turkish Cypriots: The EU's invisible Europeans
events.description: The unresolved Cyprus problem leaves Turkish Cypriots in a state of limbo within the European Union, without full EU rights, recognition or political certainty and economically and diplomatically isolated.

events.title: Trump's feud with US Fed chair Powell rattles investors
events.description: Trump's fight with Federal Reserve Chair Powell just took a new twist ‚Äî sending stocks and the dollar lower and lifting gold. DW looks into whether a new criminal investigation could put the Fed's independence at risk.

events.title: Russian investigators launch criminal case after nine babies die at Siberian maternity hospital
events.description: Russian authorities have opened a criminal investigation into a Siberian maternity hospital where nine babies died over the country‚Äôs New Year holidays, officials said Tuesday

events.title: Federal agents deploy tear gas, rubber bullets on agitators outside Minneapolis federal building
events.description: Federal agents deployed tear gas and rubber bullets against Minneapolis protesters after snowballs were allegedly thrown at vehicles, authorities said.

events.title: AFCON Senegal, Ivory Coast fans react to Trump‚Äôs World Cup 2026 travel bans
events.description: Football fans at AFCON are dismayed with US president's travel ban on select African nations before World Cup in June.

events.title: UK hunger striker Heba Muraisi: ‚ÄòI think about how or when I could die‚Äô
events.description: Palestine Action-linked prisoner, 31, says she is suffering with pain as her 72-day protest reaches a critical stage.

events.title: The surreal facades of America's strip clubs
events.description: Some people travel the world in search of adventure, while others seek out natural wonders, cultural landmarks or culinary experiences. But French photographer Fran√ßois Prost was looking for something altogether different during his recent road trip across America: strip clubs.

events.title: US frackers were already facing a global oil supply glut. Trump‚Äôs Venezuelan dream could make it worse
events.description: Picture is as murky as a barrel of oil, with US companies in 2026 expecting their first production drop in four years US shale-oil producers were already contending with oil prices at four-year lows. News that they may soon face a significant competitor in their back yard probably wasn‚Äôt how frackers wanted to greet 2026. The US capture of Venezuela‚Äôs President Nicol√°s Maduro and his wife, Cilia Flores, hit the share prices of independent shale-oil producers, such as Diamondback Energy and Devon Energy, last week. Continue reading...

events.title: 'Fly, Wild Swans' is Jung Chang's painfully personal tribute to her mother
events.description: A historian of modern China, Jung Chang turns the lens back on herself in her newest book to understand how she sees the world and why she writes about China today.

events.title: Mattel launches first Barbie with autism to promote inclusivity
events.description: Mattel creates a doll that it hopes represents some of the ways autistic people interact with the world.

events.title: Artist Kathia St Hilaire's deceptively delicate visions of chaos and resistance
events.description: Her intricately layered artwork uses metal, rubber, canvas and printmaking to create scenes of oppression, trauma and renewal. As she stages her first major exhibition in Paris, Kathia St Hilaire joins us to talk about weaving her Haitian ancestry into her pieces, how Vodun practices inspire her work and why the late Haitian poet Frank√©tienne is a kindred spirit when it comes to his cyclical vision of a chaotic world.

events.title: Hundreds in Venezuela come forward to say their loved ones are 'political prisoners'
events.description: Edilson Torres was set to be buried in his hometown after dying in a Venezuelan prison

events.title: Trump set to lead largest-ever US delegation to World Economic Forum in Davos next week
events.description: Organizers of the World Economic Forum say that U.S. President Donald Trump will return to the group's annual meeting of business, political and cultural elites in Davos, Switzerland next week, leading a record-large U.S. delegation for the event

events.title: Iran protests spark regime survival question as exiled dissident says it feels like a ‚Äòrevolution‚Äô
events.description: Iran faces unprecedented protests as citizens unite around overthrowing the Islamic Republic, marking the most serious threat to the regime since 1979.

events.title: Prosecutors seek death penalty for ex-South Korean president Yoon
events.description: Yoon is accused of leading an insurrection when he tried to impose martial law in 2024.

events.title: Rubbish landslide death toll in Philippines rises to 11
events.description: The landslide occurred at the Binaliw landfill while more than 100 workers were on site.

events.title: Cold weather and data centres drive up US greenhouse gas emissions
events.description: US emissions of planet-warming gases rise for the first time in three years.

events.title: Trump to meet Venezuelan opposition leader Machado at the White House
events.description: Machado, the winner of 2025 Nobel Peace Prize, had offered to share the honour with Trump, an award the president has long coveted.

events.title: Video: Hundreds of thousands in northern Kenya face catastrophic drought
events.description: Three consecutive seasons of drought have left people in Northern Kenya facing an emergency.

events.title: Can we cheat death?
events.description: Is ageing a natural stage of life to be honoured or a biological flaw that humanity should overcome?

events.title: Retail spending fell in March as consumers pull back
events.description: Spending at US retailers fell in March as consumers pulled back amid recessionary fears fueled by the banking crisis.

events.title: Author Chimamanda Ngozi Adichie accuses Lagos hospital of negligence after son‚Äôs death
events.description: Lawyers for Adichie and her husband serve Euracare hospital with legal notice after death of 21-month-old The Nigerian author Chimamanda Ngozi Adichie has accused a Lagos hospital of negligence after the death of one of her 21-month-old twin boys. Nkanu Nnamdi died on 6 January after a brief illness. He was one of twin boys born to Adichie and Ivara Esege, a doctor, in 2024 by surrogacy, eight years after the birth of their first child, a girl. Continue reading...

events.title: Iran expert talks about the Trump administration's strategy with Iran
events.description: NPR's Steve Inskeep speaks with Iran expert Karim Sadjadpour about the U.S. strategy toward Iran and why he believes Iran's regime could collapse.

events.title: Australia: Writers' festival called off amid boycott
events.description: The Adelaide Writers' Week retracted an invitation to an Australian-Palestinian author, citing the the Bondi Beach attack. Dozens, including the event's director and the former PM of New Zealand, withdrew in response.

events.title: Tracking the ships delivering sanctioned Russian LNG to China
events.description: Since late August 2025, China has taken delivery of at least 24 liquefied natural gas (LNG) shipments from two sanctioned Russian facilities, Arctic LNG 2 and Portovaya. This underscores increased cooperation between China and Russia as the Kremlin seeks to boost LNG exports in order to fund its war in Ukraine.

events.title: Counsel seeks death sentence for ex-S. Korean leader Yoon over martial law imposition
events.description: A Seoul court says an independent counsel has demanded a death sentence for former South Korean President Yoon Suk Yeol

events.title: Ohio dentist double murder: Fmr police chief reveals ‚Äòmultitude‚Äô of reasons ex-husband allegedly killed couple
events.description: Former police chief reveals why Ohio dentist's ex-husband allegedly killed couple. Michael McKee charged with murdering Spencer and Monique Tepe.

events.title: Mom killed shielding kids after husband erupts in rage over NFL game: police
events.description: Florida mom Crystal Roure shot protecting children when husband Jason Kenney flew into rage over NFL game, police say. Roure died after telling son to call 911.

events.title: Nobel Institute shuts down talk of Venezuelan leader sharing Peace Prize with Trump
events.description: Nobel Institute rejects suggestion from Venezuelan leader Mar√≠a Corina Machado to transfer her Peace Prize to Trump, stating awards "cannot be transferred."

events.title: Custody extended for owner of Swiss ski bar after deadly fire
events.description: Jacques Moretti is being held as a potential flight risk, Swiss media reports say.

events.title: Video: Greenland PM dodges question on Donald Trump rhetoric
events.description: Greenland PM Jens-Frederik Nielsen dodged a reporter‚Äôs question about US President Donald Trump's threats.

events.title: Ten Sydney harbours‚Äô worth of threatened species habitat cleared under Albanese government in 2025, report finds
events.description: Australian Conservation Foundation‚Äôs analysis finds the amount of habitat approved for land clearing hit a 15-year high last year Sign up for climate and environment editor Adam Morton‚Äôs free Clear Air newsletter here More than 57,000 hectares of threatened species habitat was approved for destruction by the Australian government in 2025 ‚Äì the most in 15 years, according to analysis by the Australian Conservation Foundation. The ACF‚Äôs latest annual ‚Äúextinction wrapped‚Äù report has revealed that the threatened species habitat greenlit for land clearing was about 10 times the size of Sydney Harbour ‚Äì more than double the 2024 figure , and over five times the 10,426 hectares approved for razing in 2023 . Sign up to get climate and environment editor Adam Morton‚Äôs Clear Air column as a free newsletter Continue reading...

events.title: Iranian regime targeting Starlink users in bid to squash leaking protest footage
events.description: Iran's internet blockade fails to stop protest footage leaks via Starlink as authorities reportedly kill at least 646 demonstrators in ongoing crackdown.

events.title: UK targets Elon Musk‚Äôs X with fines and possible ban over Grok deepfake abuse
events.description: The U.K.'s communications regulator, Ofcom, launched a formal investigation into Elon Musk's X platform following reports of AI chatbot Grok creating illegal deepfake images.

events.title: We choose Denmark over US, Greenland's PM says
events.description: It is the strongest statement by a leader of the Danish territory since US President Donald Trump renewed plans to annex it.

events.title: Trump administration moves to end deportation protection for Somalis
events.description: As the US cracks down on illegal immigration in Minneapolis, home to a large Somali community, it will end protections for many in the country legally.

events.title: Niger revokes licences of tanker drivers who refuse to go to Mali amid jihadist blockade
events.description: Jihadists have been targeting tankers entering Mali, worsening the country‚Äôs fuel shortage.

events.title: ‚ÄòLast straw‚Äô: Somalia cuts UAE ties after Yemen separatist‚Äôs illegal entry
events.description: Somalia cuts UAE ties after Aidarous al-Zubaidi's illegal entry through Somaliland, exposing federal divisions.

events.title: Silicon Valley Bank collapse renews calls to address disparities impacting entrepreneurs of color
events.description: When customers at Silicon Valley Bank rushed to withdraw billions of dollars last month, venture capitalist Arlan Hamilton stepped in to help some of the founders of color who panicked about losing access to payroll funds.

events.title: Minnesota sues Trump admin over immigration crackdown
events.description: The legal action comes after a 37-year-old woman was shot dead by a federal agent in Minneapolis last week. Minnesota Attorney General Keith Ellison says the federal government's actions have "made us less safe."

events.title: Ex-Corsican nationalist leader Alain Orsoni shot dead at mother's funeral
events.description: Former Corsican nationalist leader Alain Orsoni, who also served as the president of soccer club AC Ajaccio, was shot dead in Corsica on January 11 during his mother‚Äôs funeral. He was 71. Alain Orsoni was one of the leaders of the Corsican National Liberation Front (FLNC) in the 1980s. He later founded and led the Movement for Self-Determination (MPA). He left Corsica in 1996 during infighting within the nationalist movement and lived for several years in exile before returning to the island.

events.title: Built on care and connection: How one Somali-British woman is strengthening diaspora communities
events.description: When her family moved from Somalia to London in the 1980s, Safia Jama watched women in her community help her mother navigate a new life in the UK ‚Äî booking doctor‚Äôs appointments, enrolling children in school, and learning how to access everyday services in a new country.

events.title: Affluent Virginia suburb rocked as trial begins for ex-federal agent husband in nanny love-triangle murders
events.description: Former IRS agent accused of orchestrating double murder with Brazilian au pair to hide affair. Trial begins in shocking Virginia criminal case.

events.title: Luigi Mangione judge summons Pennsylvania cop to court to testify on backpack search
events.description: Federal judge reverses decision, will now hold hearing on Luigi Mangione backpack evidence seized at McDonald's during arrest for alleged CEO murder.

events.title: Greenland's prime minister says 'we choose Denmark' over the US
events.description: Greenland's prime minister said if his territory had to choose between the United States and Denmark, it would choose Denmark, a report said.

events.title: Trump cancels US-Iran meetings, urges protesters to take over institutions
events.description: Donald Trump declares 'help is on the way' for Iranian protesters, as calls for action against regime intensify.

events.title: Trump announces new 25% tariff: How will it impact Iran‚Äôs trading partners?
events.description: US president threatens a 25 percent tariff on countries that do business with Iran as he piles pressure on Tehran.

events.title: How US sanctions crippled lives of Iranians Trump says he wants to ‚Äòhelp‚Äô
events.description: US sanctions have damaged Iran's economy, which was the reason the protests broke out in the first place.

events.title: As Iran's protests continue, Israelis and Palestinians watch closely
events.description: There is broad support for the protests among Israeli officials, but Palestinians say they hope the Iranian regime stays in place and the protests die down soon.

events.title: Elon Musk's X faces bans and investigations over nonconsensual bikini images
events.description: After the social media app's AI chatbot started generating sexualized images of women and children, two countries have blocked it and several more have launched investigations.

events.title: Why Iran's communication blackout could become permanent
events.description: Iran's communication blackout is "more serious" than ever before. Restrictions may last beyond the current protests, according to one expert.

events.title: Macron brandishing 'threat of dissolution' as budget talks resume, although 'unlikely'
events.description: Crucial budget talks are resuming in French parliament, as MPs have failed to secure the 2026 budget in time last year. President Emmanuel Macron has brandished the threat of dissolution in case parties can't compromise on the text, but in practice it is unlikely to happen. FRANCE 24's Angela Diffley tells us more about the inflammable political context in which these talks are taking place.

events.title: Meet the French expats living off the grid
events.description: Some 3 million French citizens live abroad, scattered across the globe. From the snowy uplands of Quebec to a remote, desert island in Guinea-Bissau or the depths of the Ivorian forests, our France 2 colleagues went to meet some of their French compatriots who have started whole new lives. Thousands of kilometres from French shores, they are living out childhood dreams of closeness to nature and joining new communities and cultures.

events.title: French farmers drive 350 tractors to Parliament to protest low incomes, EU trade deal
events.description: French farmers have driven 350 tractors through Paris to protest low incomes and an EU trade deal with South America

events.title: Red-Washing: How the media sanitizes a Marxist-Leninist revolutionary as a ‚Äòpreschool teacher‚Äô
events.description: Far-left consultants recommend protest groups "lead with sympathetic characters." A Grand Rapids, Mich., socialist activist got just that with an arrested member rebranded a "preschool teacher."

events.title: NYC hospital accuses nurses‚Äô union of seeking protections for workers arriving drunk, high as strike begins
events.description: Historic nurses strike hits NYC as 15,000 workers walk off. Hospitals accuse union of unreasonable demands including protections for impaired staff.

events.title: Former Navy SEAL convicted for trying to harm police with explosives during California 'No Kings' protests
events.description: Former Navy SEAL convicted of transporting explosives with the intent to harm law enforcement officers at California "No Kings" protests.

events.title: US hostages in Iran face heightened risk as protests spread, experts say number held may exceed estimates
events.description: Iran's systematic hostage-taking policy targets American citizens as political leverage, with experts calling for automatic sanctions and consequences to combat the regime's strategy.

events.title: ‚ÄòWe choose Denmark‚Äô over joining US, says Greenland PM Nielsen
events.description: "If we have to choose between the United States and Denmark here and now, we choose Denmark," said Greenland's PM.

events.title: Not only is Lake Powell's water level plummeting because of drought, its total capacity is shrinking, too
events.description: Lake Powell, the second-largest human-made reservoir in the US, has lost nearly 7% of its potential storage capacity since 1963, when Glen Canyon Dam was built, a new report shows.

events.title: Minnesota sues over Trump's ICE enforcement. And, SCOTUS hears trans athlete cases
events.description: Minnesota officials sued the Trump administration over unconstitutional ICE conduct. And, SCOTUS hears two cases on whether states can bar transgender athletes from women's sports.

events.title: Syrian army declares closed military zone east of Aleppo as tensions rise with Kurds
events.description: The Syrian army has declared an area east of Aleppo a "closed military zone," signaling potential escalation with the Kurdish-led Syrian Democratic Forces (SDF)

events.title: Venezuela: UN independent investigators call for immediate release of all political prisoners
events.description: More than 100 political prisoners have been released in Venezuela, the Government announced on Monday, just over a week after the seizure and rendition of President Nicol√°s Maduro in Caracas by the United States.

events.title: As Iran weakens, questions grow over Mohammed bin Salman‚Äôs regional ambitions
events.description: Saudi Arabia asserts bold foreign policy as Iran weakens, reshaping Middle East power dynamics through strategic partnerships and regional realignments.

events.title: Look of the Week: Blackpink headline Coachella in Korean hanboks
events.description: Bringing the second day of this year's Coachella to a close, K-Pop girl group Blackpink made history Saturday night when they became the first Asian act to ever headline the festival. To a crowd of, reportedly, over 125,000 people, Jennie, Jisoo, Lisa and Ros√© used the ground-breaking moment to pay homage to Korean heritage by arriving onstage in hanboks: a traditional type of dress.

events.title: How Playboy cut ties with Hugh Hefner to create a post-MeToo brand
events.description: Hugh Hefner launched Playboy Magazine 70 years ago this year. The first issue included a nude photograph of Marilyn Monroe, which he had purchased and published without her knowledge or consent.

events.title: Access to RSS feeds is rejected
events.description: Your large amount of concurrent requests for RSS data causes problems. Use the API or contact ops@reliefweb.int

events.title: Trump announces 25% tariff on Iran's trading partners
events.description: US President Donald Trump announced a tariff of 25% on goods from countries doing business with Iran. The tariff announcement stands to impact China, Brazil, Turkey and Russia among others.

events.title: ‚ÄòBeyond GDP‚Äô economists push for clearer metrics on wellbeing, sustainability
events.description: Top finance experts are meeting at UN Geneva this week to push for a radical shake up in the way economic growth is gauged, in response to concerns that GDP measurements provide little insight about progress on key sustainability targets that are vital to our survival.

events.title: Students for Life report finds massive uptick in Christian colleges' support for abortion, Planned Parenthood
events.description: Abortion support among Christian colleges has reportedly surged 38% since Roe v. Wade was overturned, with one in seven now connected to abortion.

events.title: Big-box stores could help slash emissions and save millions by putting solar panels on roofs. Why aren't more of them doing it?
events.description: As the US attempts to wean itself off its heavy reliance on fossil fuels and shift to cleaner energy sources, many experts are eyeing a promising solution: your neighborhood big-box stores and shopping malls.

events.title: Mexico arrests 6 alleged Tren de Aragua gang members
events.description: Mexican authorities have arrested six alleged members of the Tren de Aragua gang in Mexico City for crimes related to drug trafficking, extortion, and human trafficking

events.title: Ex-congressional IT aide accused of stealing 240 government phones and selling them at pawn shop
events.description: A former congressional IT aide is accused of stealing 240 taxpayer-funded cellphones worth $150K, shipping them to his home and then selling most at a local pawn shop.

events.title: Le Pen hopeful appeal will allow her to run for French president
events.description: An appeal by France's far-right leader begins against a ruling banning her from running for public office for five years.

events.title: 'We were tricked': How one woman lures foreign men to fight on Russia's front line
events.description: Recruits tell the BBC an ex-teacher who operates on Telegram misled them, saying they could avoid combat.

events.title: BTS stand to make $1bn as they announce mammoth comeback tour
events.description: It's the K-pop band's first tour since completing compulsory military service in South Korea.

events.title: Hunt for gunman after Corsican exile is shot dead at mother's funeral
events.description: Alain Orsoni, 71, was a well-known separatist figure in Corsica who had been living in exile for years in Nicaragua.

events.title: Senator Mark Kelly sues Defence Secretary Pete Hegseth over attempted demotion
events.description: The US senator and former Navy captain is contesting a move to review his retirement grade after he criticised the Trump administration.

events.title: Pioneering gay footballer Josh Cavallo accuses former club of homophobia
events.description: Adelaide United says it "categorically rejects" Cavallo's claims he was sidelined because of his sexuality.

events.title: Jailed Venezuelan politician's son says Trump shouldn't be 'fooled' by pledge of prisoner releases
events.description: Ram√≥n Guanipa's father was accused of treason for challenging the disputed 2024 presidential election result.

events.title: Meta blocks 550,000 accounts under Australia's social media ban
events.description: The new law, which came into effect in December, is aimed at protecting children from online harm.

events.title: Thousands of tourists stranded in Lapland as cold grounds flights
events.description: All flights out of Kittila airport in northern Finland were cancelled on Sunday with temperatures falling as low as -38C.

events.title: Nigeria vs Morocco: AFCON semifinal ‚Äì team news, start time and lineups
events.description: Host nation Morocco chase their dream of winning AFCON on home soil against heavyweights Nigeria in Semifinal 2.

events.title: Somali minister explains why UAE ‚Äòsmuggling‚Äô of fugitive was ‚Äòlast straw‚Äô
events.description: Somali government minister Ali Omar says the UAE improperly used Somali airspace to smuggle a Yemeni separatist leader.

events.title: Why Iran is not repeating 1979
events.description: The nature of power in Tehran today is very different from what it was in the 1970s.

events.title: Why was Alonso sacked by Real Madrid, and who‚Äôs their new manager Arbeloa?
events.description: A Supercopa final loss to Barcelona proves final nail in the coffin and ends the Xabi Alonso era at Real Madrid.

events.title: Michael Carrick signs deal with Man United to be interim head coach
events.description: Former United player Michael Carrick will take charge of the famous English football club after agreeing to terms.

events.title: Inuit fisherman fears US takeover of Greenland
events.description: Inuit Greenlander Joel Hansen has many reasons to oppose a US takeover of his home.

events.title: Markets digest bank earnings after recent turmoil
events.description: No description available.

events.title: Still haven't filed your taxes? Here's what you need to know
events.description: So far this tax season, the IRS has received more than 90 million income tax returns for 2022.

events.title: Analysis: Fox News is about to enter the true No Spin Zone
events.description: This is it.

events.title: Scientists identify secret ingredient in Leonardo da Vinci paintings
events.description: "Old Masters" such as Leonardo da Vinci, Sandro Botticelli and Rembrandt may have used proteins, especially egg yolk, in their oil paintings, according to a new study.

events.title: 'A definitive backslide.' Inside fashion's worrying runway trend
events.description: Now that the Fall-Winter 2023 catwalks have been disassembled, it's clear one trend was more pervasive than any collective penchant for ruffles, pleated skirts or tailored coats.

events.title: Michael Jordan's 1998 NBA Finals sneakers sell for a record $2.2 million
events.description: In 1998, Michael Jordan laced up a pair of his iconic black and red Air Jordan 13s to bring home a Bulls victory during Game 2 of his final NBA championship ‚Äî and now they are the most expensive sneakers ever to sell at auction. The game-winning sneakers sold for $2.2 million at Sotheby's in New York on Tuesday, smashing the sneaker auction record of $1.47 million, set in 2021 by a pair of Nike Air Ships that Jordan wore earlier in his career.

events.title: Here's the real reason to turn on airplane mode when you fly
events.description: We all know the routine by heart: "Please ensure your seats are in the upright position, tray tables stowed, window shades are up, laptops are stored in the overhead bins and electronic devices are set to flight mode."

events.title: 'I was up to my waist down a hippo's throat.' He survived, and here's his advice
events.description: Paul Templer was living his best life.

events.title: Relaxed entry rules make it easier than ever to visit this stunning Asian nation
events.description: Due to its remoteness and short summer season, Mongolia has long been a destination overlooked by travelers.

events.title: The most beautiful sections of China's Great Wall
events.description: Having lived in Beijing for almost 12 years, I've had plenty of time to travel widely in China.

events.title: Sign up to our newsletter for a weekly roundup of travel news
events.description: No description available.

events.title: Australian politicians are condemning X and Grok, so why won‚Äôt they leave the platform?
events.description: Anthony Albanese has said the AI chatbot generating sexualised images of women and children is ‚Äòabhorrent‚Äô but has an account posting on the site Follow our Australia news live blog for latest updates Anthony Albanese condemned X‚Äôs AI chatbot Grok generation of sexualised images of women and children as ‚Äúabhorrent‚Äù, but don‚Äôt expect the prime minister ‚Äì or seemingly any politician in Australia ‚Äì to stop using the site any time soon. Albanese condemned the use of generative AI to exploit or sexualise people without their consent, saying on Saturday that Australians deserved better. He added that the online safety regulator would look into it. Continue reading...

events.title: Moment Western Australian divers surface to see their boat had disappeared caught in footage
events.description: Ryan Chapman and a friend survived 90 minutes in the ocean before being picked up by a passing boat ‚Äì and carrying on with their dive Get our breaking news email , free app or daily news podcast Two divers have survived becoming stranded in the ocean after losing their boat while diving in a popular fishing spot in Western Australia. Ryan Chapman and his mate were free diving and scuba diving about 5km off Mindarie, a coastal suburb north of Perth, when they resurfaced to find their boat had disappeared. Continue reading...

events.title: Markets and restaurants return to Gaza, but few can afford the expensive price tag
events.description: New eateries are popping up in Gaza after months of famine, but it's pricey and many people still rely on aid to survive.

events.title: Japan, South Korea vow stronger ties amid China challenge
events.description: Japan and South Korea are seeking to strengthen cooperation amid growing geopolitical risks and Tokyo‚Äôs worsening relations with Beijing.

events.title: Will Trump risk a clash with China over Iran tariff?
events.description: Donald Trump‚Äôs sudden 25% tariff on nations trading with Iran puts Beijing squarely in the spotlight. China knows how to evade sanctions and has the muscle to retaliate. DW explores what this showdown could mean.

events.title: France: Le Pen in court to appeal 2027 election ban
events.description: Marine Le Pen, the far-right heavyweight of French politics is seeking to overturn a court ruling that blocked her presidential bid.

events.title: Will Uganda's election bring change or further hardship?
events.description: Ahead of Uganda's presidential election, optimists hope for change while others fear chaos, repression, and another term for President Yoweri Museveni.

events.title: Trump to meet with Venezuelan opposition leader Machado
events.description: After winning the Nobel Peace Prize Trump had wanted and then being sidelined from a post-Maduro Venezuela, Machado is now set to meet with the US president.

events.title: German Chancellor Merz visits India's tech hub Bengaluru
events.description: Merz is due in Bengaluru, often called India's Silicon Valley, after meeting PM Modi in Ahmedabad. The visit comes just weeks ahead of plans to sign a long-awaited free trade agreement between India and the EU.

events.title: 'Cultural, political, social phenomenon': Surge in support for far right in US, UK, France, Italy
events.description: In a turbulent political landscape marked by disillusionment and shifting loyalties, France stands at a critical juncture. The far-right‚Äôs rise is not an isolated French phenomenon but a mirror of broader political trends taking root in the West, driven by what Professor Paul Smith, Head of Modern Languages at the University of Nottingham, calls ‚Äúthe politics of frustration‚Äù and the feeling of being ‚Äúleft behind‚Äù. As France prepares for a post-Macron future, will the center continue their descent, giving way to the far right and far left?

events.title: Marine Le Pen ‚Äòfeels hopeful‚Äô as appeal trial begins
events.description: French far-right leader Marine Le Pen is set to return to court on Tuesday to appeal a graft conviction, with her 2027 presidential ambitions hanging in the balance. Le Pen was banned from standing for office for five years, which effectively disqualified her from running in next year's presidential race.

events.title: Marine Le Pen's appeal trial is 'first act of 2027 presidential election'
events.description: Marine Le Pen is seeking to overturn a March 2025 ruling that found her guilty of misusing European Parliament funds. She was given a five-year ban from holding elected office, two years of house arrest with an electronic bracelet, a further two-year suspended sentence and a 100,000-euro fine. If Le Pen is ultimately prevented from running in 2027, party leader Jordan Bardella is widely expected to be her successor. His popularity has surged, particularly among younger voters, though some within the party have questioned his leadership.

events.title: Hearing in Marine Le Pen appeal trial expected summer 2026
events.description: Marine Le Pen's presidential ambitions hang in the balance as the French far-right leader goes to court to appeal against an embezzlement conviction, which barred her from running for office for five years. She has always maintained her innocence and is appealing along with twelve others of the accused. The ruling with could in the summer of 2026.

events.title: Marine Le Pen to switch legal strategy in appeal as case opens in Paris
events.description: France‚Äôs far-right leader Marine Le Pen returned to court Tuesday to appeal an embezzlement conviction, with her 2027 presidential ambitions hanging on the outcome of the case. If she is ultimately prevented from running in 2027, Bardella is widely expected to be her successor. His popularity has surged, particularly among younger voters, though some within the party have questioned his leadership. FRANCE 24's Olivia Bizot tells us more from the Paris courthouse.

events.title: Australian author charged over child exploitation material
events.description: Australian author Craig Silvey has been charged with possessing and distributing child exploitation material.

events.title: Airports close and flights disrupted as freezing rain and snow hits Europe
events.description: Airports were forced to close and flights were disrupted in parts of Europe due to icy weather.

events.title: BTS reveal comeback tour after completing military service
events.description: K-pop superstars BTS have announced details of their much-anticipated comeback tour, after a break of almost four years to complete mandatory military service.

events.title: New study finds astronauts' brains change after space travel
events.description: New research into the health effects of spaceflight has shown astronauts' brains change position and shape over time.

events.title: Puerto Rico announces compulsory visits to assess conditions in housing projects
events.description: Puerto Rico is announcing compulsory visits to the island‚Äôs 328 public housing projects to check on residents and their living conditions

events.title: Iraq's prime minister steps aside for rival in post-election wrangling over government
events.description: Iraq‚Äôs caretaker Prime Minister Mohammed Shia al-Sudani has stepped aside to clear the way for former Prime Minister Nouri al-Maliki, according to two Iraqi officials

events.title: Denmark provided US support on intercepting oil tanker, Danish official says
events.description: A Danish government official says Denmark provided the U.S. with support seizing an oil tanker violating sanctions amid the dispute over Greenland

events.title: Czech Prime Minister Babi≈° faces confidence vote as government shifts Ukraine policy
events.description: The Czech Republic‚Äôs new government of populist Prime Minister Andrej Babi≈° faces a mandatory confidence vote in Parliament

events.title: Hungary sets April 12 election date as Orb√°n faces tough challenge
events.description: Hungary's parliamentary election is set for April 12, with Prime Minister Viktor Orb√°n expected to face his toughest challenge in 16 years

events.title: Marine Le Pen's appeal trial opens in Paris, with far-right leader's 2027 presidential bid at stake
events.description: Marine Le Pen's appeal trial opens in Paris, with far-right leader's 2027 presidential bid at stake

events.title: Freezing rain and ice disrupt travel across central and eastern Europe
events.description: Freezing rain and icy conditions have caused widespread travel disruptions across central and eastern Europe

events.title: China urges Canada to break from US influence as PM Carney visits Beijing
events.description: China is hoping President Trump's economic and military actions against other countries will weaken the U.S.-Canada relationship

events.title: Marine Le Pen's appeal trial opens in Paris, with far-right leader's 2027 presidential bid at stake
events.description: France‚Äôs far-right leader Marine Le Pen returns to court to appeal an embezzlement conviction

events.title: Amidst uncertainty, a helpline in Pakistan becomes a lifeline for Afghans
events.description: They ask heartbreaking questions: ‚ÄúWhat will happen to us?‚Äù ‚ÄúIs it true they will deport us?‚Äù ‚ÄúWe don‚Äôt want to go back. How can I live in Afghanistan?‚Äù The words of Sumaiya, who staffs a helpline for refugees and asylum-seekers living in Pakistan but facing the eventuality of having to return to neighbouring Afghanistan.

events.title: Mississippi synagogue arson suspect's dad turns him in after laughing confession, FBI says
events.description: A man accused of a Mississippi synagogue arson confessed to his father, saying he "finally got them," the FBI said. Stephen Pittman faces charges.

events.title: Supreme Court hears arguments over trans athletes in girls' sports and more top headlines
events.description: Get all the stories you need-to-know from the most powerful name in news delivered first thing every morning to your inbox.

events.title: Former US Navy sailor learns sentence for spying for China
events.description: Former Navy sailor Jinchao Wei sentenced to 200 months in prison for selling classified military secrets to Chinese intelligence officer for $12,000.

events.title: Minnesota sues Trump admin over sweeping immigration raids in Twin Cities
events.description: Minnesota sues Trump administration over alleged militarized immigration raids in Twin Cities, naming DHS Secretary Kristi Noem and ICE officials.

events.title: New Jersey man fractures girl's skull by allegedly throwing rock through school bus window, arrest made
events.description: A New Jersey man was arrested after allegedly throwing a rock that smashed through a school bus window, fracturing a young girl‚Äôs skull, police said.

events.title: Barry Morphew pleads not guilty to murdering wife Suzanne Morphew years after after Mother‚Äôs Day disappearance
events.description: Barry Morphew accused of killing wife Suzanne returns to court to enter plea on murder charges. Case began with her Mother's Day 2020 disappearance.
